\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 92721}

\subsection*{Overheating and Dehydration }
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{Hug Bug}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 &   &  & Sassafras & \\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 0.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}
I've enjoyed Sassafras in many forms.  Smoked, tea, incense, root beer, and chewed raw.  



There is a risk of dehydration and overheating.  It really shouldn't be mixed with alcohol, especially not in summertime.

\end{document}
